members.name: getParams
members.comment: Get the algorithm parameters that define the curve and other settings.

members.name: getU
members.comment: Get the u coordinate of the point.

return: the u-coordinate, represented using a BigInteger which may hold any value

members.comment: Construct a public key spec using the supplied parameters and u coordinate.

param: u - the u-coordinate of the point, represented using a BigInteger which may hold any value
throws: NullPointerException - if params or u is null.

name: java.security.spec.XECPublicKeySpec
comment: A class representing elliptic curve public keys as defined in RFC 7748, including the curve and other algorithm parameters. The public key is a particular point on the curve, which is represented using only its u-coordinate. A u-coordinate is an element of the field of integers modulo some value that is determined by the algorithm parameters. This field element is represented by a BigInteger which may hold any value. That is, the BigInteger is not restricted to the range of canonical field elements.
